name: I saw II and can't wait for III...
reviewBody: It sure looks i didn't have to see saw to see its sequel, because this sequel is as self-contained as possible... well, ladies and gentlemen, we are watching another step in the evolution of crime, horror, and thrill, and ironically this declaration applies to the evolution of the plot, the scope, and the theme of the screenplay itself and its genre as well, so there is something more that meets the eye in this both apparent and self-evident fake of an experiment, because of the very mechanisms of spectacle, narrative, and perspective... so in a nutshell i liked the presentation of a perverse philosophy in a perverse genre executed with a seemingly unpretentious but subtly stylish perversity... this work of art deserves kudos because it twists and turns the predictable, the trivial, and the well-known commonplaces into ultimate reaction, singularity, and accomplishment... there are no false promises or false fears anymore in this view of the human condition, and every outrage will continue to focus and will not fade away until we come to terms with our guilt and self-indulgence... including my own commentary, of course.
